result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Joseph LaSarge

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Cases 19CF253, 2019CF000256, 2020CF000186, 2021CF000045, 2021CT000019, 2022CF000029, 2022CF000145, and 2022TR000063 called together.  Defendant Dennis Joseph LaSarge in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Dennis Joseph LaSarge.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Bonneson: def pleading to amended Count 1- simple possession of meth in 19CF253, Count 3- domestic battery in 19CF256, Count 1- felony bail jump in 20CF186 and Count 2- felony bond jump in 22CF29; strangulation and reckless endangerment counts to be dismissed outright, all others DRI; with or without PSI, State not to recommend executed prison; otherwise free to argue.  Atty Bonneson makes record of amended information in 19CF253.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights. State moves to amend Count 1 of 19CF253 to remove the enhancer; granted.  State moves to amend Count 3 of 19CF256 to add domestic abuse enhancer and remove the repeater enhancer; Court grants.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of to amended Count 1 of 19CF253, amended Count 3 of 19CF256, Count 1 of 20CF186, and Count 2 of 22CF29 and orders a JOC; Counts 1 and 2 of 19CF256 dismissed outright; remainder DRI.  State assures VR compliance.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Court willing to hear bond motion.  Atty Bonneson argues for bond modification to signature bond and remove no contact order.  State responds.  Court denies bond modification; revokes bond until sentencing.  Court addresses the defendant.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:47 AM Cases 19CF253, 2019CF000256, 2020CF000186, 2021CF000045, 2021CT000019, 2022CF000029, and 2022CF000145 called together. Defendant Dennis Joseph LaSarge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Dennis Joseph LaSarge. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Prior to going on the record, attorney Bonneson noted an agreement has been reached and recited for the court.  Court confirms defendant is accepting the agreement and withdrawing demands for speedy trials.  Court intends to order a PSI.  Court will allow Zoom for plea, but requires an all in-person for sentencing hearing.  Atty Bonneson argues for bond modification to $2500.  State argues to keep a cash bond in place.  Court denies bond modification at this time; atty Bonneson may renew his request at next hearing.  JT-12s to be removed from calendar.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Motion hearing on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:25 PM Cases 20CF186, 2019CF000253, 2019CF000256, 2020TR001105, 2021CF000045, 2021CT000019, 2022CF000029, 2022CF000145, and 2022TR000063 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dennis Joseph LaSarge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Dennis Joseph LaSarge.  Case on for bail/bond hearing on atty Bonneson's motion.  Atty Bonneson argues to reduce cash to $1000.  State opposes cash reduction, argues.  Court denies bond modification.

Bail/bond hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bail/bond hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:47 AM Cases 19CF253, 2019CF000256, 2020CF000186, 2020TR001105, 2021CF000045, 2021CT000019, 2022CF000029, 2022CF000145, and 2022TR000063 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dennis Joseph LaSarge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Dennis Joseph LaSarge. Case 22CF145 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def indicates it's waiving prelim.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint. Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Def demands speedy in 22CF145 case; Court notes she'd need to also set a speedy in the older, victim case.  Case 19CF256, JT-12 set for 10/19/22; case 22CF145, JT-12 set for 10/11/22; FPTs set for 9/15/2022 at 9:15 AM.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: $5,000 cash bond is ordered to cover Burnett County cases 19CF253, 19CF256, 20CF186, 21CF45, 21CT19, 22CF29 and 22CF145. No contact with all  victims (J.J., S.C., and D.L.) or their residences.

9:20 AM Called 19CF253, 19CF256, 20CF186, 21CF45, 21CT19, 22CF29 and 22TR63 for STC and 22CF145 for INIT.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dennis Joseph LaSarge appeared by video in custody at the Burnett County Jail.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Dennis Joseph LaSarge.   Case 22CF145 just filed this morning.  Court ready to set 2019 cases for trial unless global resolution.  Attny Bonneson updates the court, with new charges the DA's office has revised their offer but he hasn't had time to discuss with def.  New offer recited by the State, offer to plead to meth in 19CF253, reckless endangering in 19CF256, felony bail jump in 22CF29, felony bail jump and misdemeanor battery in new charges 22CF145, PSI and both sides free to argue.  New charges were just filed this morning.  Currently was on signature bond, with new charges Judge sets $5,000 cash bond, no contact with all victims or their residences.  Significant history of failing to appear so cash is necessary.  All other conditions of previous bonds are included.  Victims rights compliance.
Initial Appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
